description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to amend condition no.5 (existing crossover), in pursuant to planning permission reference 194664FUL dated 14/02/2020 for' Construction of a two storey detached dwelling house'
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from 14.02.2020 when permission was granted.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings: Site Location Plan, 1, received 11th February 2020, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, Design and Access Statement (Original approval) and Proposed Block Plan, received 13.12.2022
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing donor property known as 36 Brassie Avenue.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the Consolidated London Plan (2016) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A to H of Schedule 2 Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), no permitted development shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013 and policy 7.4 and of the London Plan 2016.

| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, pedestrian visibility splays should be provided at all times measuring 1.5m by 1.5m, with no obstruction more than 0.6m in height for the vehicle access where it meets the back edge of the footway; these shall be established prior to the first use of the driveway and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: In the interest of highways safety in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Publication London Plan 2021 policy T6.

| Prior to occupation of the development, hereby approved, refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, shall be provided for all occupants of the development, in the curtilage of the proposed building, and fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policies 5.17 of the London Plan 2016; 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012; and 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013.

| Prior to occupation of the development, A minimum of 2 (two) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided each for the approved property and the donor property known as 36 Brassie Road in accordance with the adopted standards of the London Plan 2016. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 6.1, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016.
